member.name: CMSG_CTRL_VERIFY_SIGNATURE_EX_PARA
member.summary: The CMSG_CTRL_VERIFY_SIGNATURE_EX_PARA structure contains information used to verify a message signature. It contains the signer index and signer public key. The signer public key can be the signer's structure, certificate context, or chain context.

member.name: CMSG_CTRL_VERIFY_SIGNATURE_EX_PARA.cbSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of this structure.

summary.para: This member is not used and should be set to NULL.

Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: A handle to the cryptographic provider used to verify the signature. If NULL, the cryptographic provider specified in is used. If the hCryptProv in CryptMsgOpenToDecode is also NULL, the default provider according to the signer's public key object identifier (OID) is used.This member's data type is HCRYPTPROV.

member.name: CMSG_CTRL_VERIFY_SIGNATURE_EX_PARA.dwSignerIndex
member.summary: The index of the signer in the message.

summary.para: The structure that contains the signer information. The following table shows the predefined values and the structures indicated.

member.name: CMSG_CTRL_VERIFY_SIGNATURE_EX_PARA.pvSigner
member.summary: A pointer to a structure, a certificate context, a chain context, or NULL depending on the value of dwSignerType.
